content.question: In The Federalist 70, Alexander Hamilton states that “energy in the executive is a leading character in the definition of good government.” In this statement, Hamilton is arguing in favor of the need for

choices.label: a single executive who can respond quickly to crises
a president who has a good understanding of public policy
an electoral college in the selection of the president
a president who is youthful and assertive

content.answer: a single executive who can respond quickly to crises
